result.execSummary:
The defendant Abrianna P Marr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random screenings.
.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

Credit for 42 days of probation revoked.
.

.

records.addlTxt: expelled

State by John Kellis / Drug Court Team / Def in custody
CRT:  Expulsion Motion has been made - explains process to the defendant
Def doesn't want to fight this.  Def has talked to attorneys Keith Belzer & Jeff Mochalski.  Def feels she's had enough time to confer w/ counsel - No promises/Threats.  Def asks CRT to accept her Waiver of Right to Expulsion Hrg.
CRT finds def has F & V Waived her right to fight Motion to Expel - Waived right to have a Hearing.  Revocation process will get started.
CRT:  DEF IS EXPELLED FROM DRUG COURT
Probation extended 1 yr to 5/30/18 or until commencement from Drug Court & completion of financial obligations, whichever occurs first.
